intro: Epitrachys italica, commonly known as the Italian epitrachys, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
